briefdescription.para: Allocate a new channel.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to use.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a newly allocated channel, NULL on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *type, uint32_t window, uint32_t maxpacket, ssh_buffer payload)
memberdef.name: channel_open

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *data, size_t len, bool is_stderr)
memberdef.name: channel_default_bufferize

briefdescription.para: Open a session channel (suited for a shell, not TCP forwarding).

parameterdescription.para: An allocated channel.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Open an agent authentication forwarding channel. This type of channel can be opened by a server towards a client in order to provide SSH-Agent services to the server-side process. This channel can only be opened if the client claimed support by sending a channel request beforehand.

parameterdescription.para: An allocated channel.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *remotehost, int remoteport, const char *sourcehost, int localport)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_open_forward

briefdescription.para: Open a TCP/IP forwarding channel.

parameterdescription.para: An allocated channel.
The remote host to connected (host name or IP).
The remote port.
The numeric IP address of the machine from where the connection request originates. This is mostly for logging purposes.
The port on the host from where the connection originated. This is mostly for logging purposes.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
This function does not bind the local port and does not automatically forward the content of a socket to the channel. You still have to use channel_read and channel_write for this.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *remotepath, const char *sourcehost, int localport)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_open_forward_unix

briefdescription.para: Open a TCP/IP - UNIX domain socket forwarding channel.

parameterdescription.para: An allocated channel.
The UNIX socket path on the remote machine
The numeric IP address of the machine from where the connection request originates. This is mostly for logging purposes.
The port on the host from where the connection originated. This is mostly for logging purposes.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
This function does not bind the local port and does not automatically forward the content of a socket to the channel. You still have to use channel_read and channel_write for this.
Requires support of OpenSSH for UNIX domain socket forwarding.

briefdescription.para: Close and free a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to free.

simplesect.para: Any data unread on this channel will be lost.

briefdescription.para: Send an end of file on the channel.

detaileddescription.para: This doesn't close the channel. You may still read from it but not write.

briefdescription.para: Close a channel.

detaileddescription.para: This sends an end of file and then closes the channel. You won't be able to recover any data the server was going to send or was in buffers.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to close.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const void *data, uint32_t len, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: channel_write_common

briefdescription.para: Get the remote window size.

detaileddescription.para: This is the maximum amounts of bytes the remote side expects us to send before growing the window again.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to query.

simplesect.para: The remote window size
A nonzero return value does not guarantee the socket is ready to send that much data. Buffering may happen in the local SSH packet buffer, so beware of really big window sizes.
A zero return value means ssh_channel_write (default settings) will block until the window grows back.

briefdescription.para: Blocking write on a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to write to.
A pointer to the data to write.
The length of the buffer to write to.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes written, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Check if the channel is open or not.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to check.

simplesect.para: 0 if channel is closed, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the channel is closed or not.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to check.

simplesect.para: 0 if channel is opened, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if remote has sent an EOF.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to check.

simplesect.para: 0 if there is no EOF, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Put the channel into blocking or nonblocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to use.
A boolean for blocking or nonblocking.

simplesect.para: A side-effect of this is to put the whole session in non-blocking mode.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *request, ssh_buffer buffer, int reply)
memberdef.name: channel_request

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *terminal, int col, int row)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_request_pty_size

briefdescription.para: Request a pty with a specific type and size.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to sent the request.
The terminal type ("vt100, xterm,...").
The number of columns.
The number of rows.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Request a PTY.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Change the size of the terminal associated to a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to change the size.
The new number of columns.
The new number of rows.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred.
Do not call it from a signal handler if you are not sure any other libssh function using the same channel/session is running at same time (not 100% threadsafe).

briefdescription.para: Request a shell.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Request a subsystem (for example "sftp").

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.
The subsystem to request (for example "sftp").

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
You normally don't have to call it for sftp, see sftp_new().

briefdescription.para: Request sftp subsystem on the channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to request the sftp subsystem.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
You should use sftp_new() which does this for you.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, int single_connection, const char *protocol, const char *cookie, int screen_number)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_request_x11

briefdescription.para: Sends the "x11-req" channel request over an existing session channel.

detaileddescription.para: This will enable redirecting the display of the remote X11 applications to local X server over an secure tunnel.

parameterdescription.para: An existing session channel where the remote X11 applications are going to be executed.
A boolean to mark only one X11 app will be redirected.
A x11 authentication protocol. Pass NULL to use the default value MIT-MAGIC-COOKIE-1.
A x11 authentication cookie. Pass NULL to generate a random cookie.
The screen number.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, int channeltype, int timeout_ms, int *destination_port)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_accept

briefdescription.para: Accept an X11 forwarding channel.

parameterdescription.para: An x11-enabled session channel.
Timeout in milliseconds.

simplesect.para: A newly created channel, or NULL if no X11 request from the server.

briefdescription.para: Send an "auth-agent-req" channel request over an existing session channel.

detaileddescription.para: This client-side request will enable forwarding the agent over an secure tunnel. When the server is ready to open one authentication agent channel, an ssh_channel_open_request_auth_agent_callback event will be generated.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send signal.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *request, ssh_buffer buffer, int reply)
memberdef.name: ssh_global_request

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *address, int port, int *bound_port)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_listen_forward

briefdescription.para: Sends the "tcpip-forward" global request to ask the server to begin listening for inbound connections.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to send the request.
The address to bind to on the server. Pass NULL to bind to all available addresses on all protocol families supported by the server.
The port to bind to on the server. Pass 0 to ask the server to allocate the next available unprivileged port number
The pointer to get actual bound port. Pass NULL to ignore.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *address, int port, int *bound_port)
memberdef.name: ssh_forward_listen

briefdescription.para: Accept an incoming TCP/IP forwarding channel and get information about incomming connection.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to use.
A timeout in milliseconds.
A pointer to destination port or NULL.

simplesect.para: Newly created channel, or NULL if no incoming channel request from the server

briefdescription.para: Sends the "cancel-tcpip-forward" global request to ask the server to cancel the tcpip-forward request.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to send the request.
The bound address on the server.
The bound port on the server.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Set environment variables.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to set the environment variables.
The name of the variable.
The value to set.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
Some environment variables may be refused by security reasons.

briefdescription.para: Run a shell command without an interactive shell.
Send a signal to remote process (as described in RFC 4254, section 6.9).

detaileddescription.para: Sends a signal 'sig' to the remote process. Note, that remote system may not support signals concept. In such a case this request will be silently ignored. Only SSH-v2 is supported (I'm not sure about SSH-v1).
OpenSSH doesn't support signals yet, see: https://bugzilla.mindrot.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1424

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send signal.

The signal to send (without SIG prefix)
SIGABRT -> ABRT SIGALRM -> ALRM SIGFPE -> FPE SIGHUP -> HUP SIGILL -> ILL SIGINT -> INT SIGKILL -> KILL SIGPIPE -> PIPE SIGQUIT -> QUIT SIGSEGV -> SEGV SIGTERM -> TERM SIGUSR1 -> USR1 SIGUSR2 -> USR2

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred (including attempts to send signal via SSH-v1 session).

briefdescription.para: Send a break signal to the server (as described in RFC 4335).

detaileddescription.para: Sends a break signal to the remote process. Note, that remote system may not support breaks. In such a case this request will be silently ignored. Only SSH-v2 is supported.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the break to.
The break-length in milliseconds to send.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred (including attempts to send signal via SSH-v1 session).

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, ssh_buffer buffer, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: channel_read_buffer

briefdescription.para: Read data from a channel into a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to read from.
The buffer which will get the data.
The count of bytes to be read. If it is bigger than 0, the exact size will be read, else (bytes=0) it will return once anything is available.
A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error.
This function doesn't work in nonblocking/timeout mode

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to read from.
The destination buffer which will get the data.
The count of bytes to be read.
A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error. In nonblocking mode it Can return 0 if no data is available or SSH_AGAIN.
This function may return less than count bytes of data, and won't block until count bytes have been read.
The read function using a buffer has been renamed to channel_read_buffer().

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr, int timeout_ms)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read_timeout

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to read from.
The destination buffer which will get the data.
The count of bytes to be read.
A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.
A timeout in milliseconds. A value of -1 means infinite timeout.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error. In nonblocking mode it Can return 0 if no data is available or SSH_AGAIN.
This function may return less than count bytes of data, and won't block until count bytes have been read.
The read function using a buffer has been renamed to channel_read_buffer().

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read_nonblocking

briefdescription.para: Do a nonblocking read on the channel.

detaileddescription.para: A nonblocking read on the specified channel. it will return <= count bytes of data read atomically.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to read from.
A pointer to a destination buffer.
The count of bytes of data to be read.
A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 if nothing is available or SSH_ERROR on error.
Don't forget to check for EOF as it would return 0 here.

briefdescription.para: Polls a channel for data to read.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to poll.
A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes available for reading, 0 if nothing is available or SSH_ERROR on error.
When the channel is in EOF state, the function returns SSH_EOF.

briefdescription.para: Polls a channel for data to read, waiting for a certain timeout.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to poll.
Set an upper limit on the time for which this function will block, in milliseconds. Specifying a negative value means an infinite timeout. This parameter is passed to the poll() function.
A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes available for reading, 0 if nothing is available (timeout elapsed), SSH_EOF on end of file, SSH_ERROR on error.
When the channel is in EOF state, the function returns SSH_EOF.

briefdescription.para: Recover the session in which belongs a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to recover the session from.

simplesect.para: The session pointer.

briefdescription.para: Get the exit status of the channel (error code from the executed instruction).

detaileddescription.para:
channel
The channel to get the status from.
The exit status, -1 if no exit status has been returned (yet), or SSH_ERROR on error.
This function may block until a timeout (or never) if the other side is not willing to close the channel.
If you're looking for an async handling of this register a callback for the exit status.

briefdescription.para: Act like the standard select(2) on channels.

detaileddescription.para: The list of pointers are then actualized and will only contain pointers to channels that are respectively readable, writable or have an exception to trap.

parameterdescription.para: A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.
A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.
A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.
Timeout as defined by select(2).

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on a successful operation, SSH_EINTR if the select(2) syscall was interrupted, then relaunch the function, or SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Set the channel data counter.

parameterdescription.para: The SSH channel.
Counter for bytes handled by the channel.

briefdescription.para: Blocking write on a channel stderr.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to write to.
A pointer to the data to write.
The length of the buffer to write to.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes written, SSH_ERROR on error.

detaileddescription.para: Functions that manage a SSH channel.
